full_text: Case 1:20-cr-00330-PAE Document 763 Filed 08/10/22 Page 57 of 197 2598 LCHVMAX2 Richards - direct 1 A. Yes. 2 Q. Does that training and experience involve how to listen to people talk? 3 A. What we try to do is listen to get the details as accurate as possible. 4 Q. Okay. And when you're listening and trying to get the details as accurate as possible, are you trying to gather information via open-ended questions to elicit responses from witnesses? 5 A. Yes. 6 Q. As part of your training and experience, do you try to limit anybody from telling you anything? 7 A. No. 8 Q. And as part of your investigation and training, are you looking to get as much relevant information as possible from anyone you're interviewing about a particular topic or subject? 9 A. Yes. 10 Q. Now, I want to direct your attention to 2007, which would be about a year after you began working in Palm Beach; correct? 11 A. Correct. 12 Q. You were working with an agent Nesbitt Kuyrkendall. Do you recall Agent Kuyrkendall? 13 A. Yes. 14 Q. And you and Agent Nesbitt Kuyrkendall were interviewing witnesses together in tandem; is that right? 15 SOUTHERN DISTRICT REPORTERS, P.C. (212) 805-0300 DOJ-OGR-00014163
